body:
Currently the kubelet exports liveness/readiness probe metric information at an [endpoint 'metrics/probes'](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5c2fe63591acab508e1ff5771c3aa70268852318/pkg/kubelet/server/server.go#L79). 

The metric data looks like this:

```
# HELP prober_probe_result The result of a liveness or readiness probe for a container.
# TYPE prober_probe_result gauge
prober_probe_result{container="etcd-container",container_name="etcd-container",namespace="kube-system",pod="etcd-server-events-kubernetes-master",pod_name="etcd-server-events-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="etcd-container",container_name="etcd-container",namespace="kube-system",pod="etcd-server-kubernetes-master",pod_name="etcd-server-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="fluentd-gcp",container_name="fluentd-gcp",namespace="kube-system",pod="fluentd-gcp-v3.2.0-g7ftb",pod_name="fluentd-gcp-v3.2.0-g7ftb",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="kube-apiserver",container_name="kube-apiserver",namespace="kube-system",pod="kube-apiserver-kubernetes-master",pod_name="kube-apiserver-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="kube-apiserver",container_name="kube-apiserver",namespace="kube-system",pod="kube-apiserver-kubernetes-master",pod_name="kube-apiserver-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Readiness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="kube-controller-manager",container_name="kube-controller-manager",namespace="kube-system",pod="kube-controller-manager-kubernetes-master",pod_name="kube-controller-manager-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="kube-scheduler",container_name="kube-scheduler",namespace="kube-system",pod="kube-scheduler-kubernetes-master",pod_name="kube-scheduler-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
prober_probe_result{container="l7-lb-controller",container_name="l7-lb-controller",namespace="kube-system",pod="l7-lb-controller-v1.2.3-kubernetes-master",pod_name="l7-lb-controller-v1.2.3-kubernetes-master",pod_uid="",probe_type="Liveness"} 0
```

This is incredibly useful metric information, however, it would be better if these metrics were counters rather than gauges. Currently a success probe is registered as a '0' value and a failure is registered as a '1' value. However, depending on your prometheus scrape interval, you can lose bits of information. It would be better if we emitted these metrics as counters.

/sig instrumentation node

title: kubelet 'metrics/probes' endpoint uses a gauge instead of counters
